CONTENTS.P: Project: Guymri Urban Roads Project
Country: Republic of Armenia
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure
Project number: 9008-IFT-46540(NM)
Funding sources: EBRD
Contract type: Project goods, works and services
Notice type: Invitation for Tenders
Issue date: 1.3.2018
Closing date: 17.4.2018, 11:00 local (Yerevan) time
This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice (nº 8783-GPN-46540) for this project which was published on the EBRD website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 1.8.2017.

Municipality of Gyumri, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends using part of the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Gyumri Urban Roads Project.

The Employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan: CW-ICB-2018/04 “Road rehabilitation works on Garegin Njdeh Avenue, Tigran Mets avenue, Sayat Nova street, Hayuhu square”.
Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

— The Tenderer shall have an average annual turnover as prime contractor (defined as billing for works in progress and completed) over the last 5 (five) years of not less than 2 700 000 (two million and seven hundred thousand) EUR equivalent,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means sufficient to meet the construction cash flow for the contract for a period of 4 (four) months, estimated as not less than 770 000 (seven hundred and seventy thousand) EUR equivalent, taking into account the applicant's commitments for other contracts,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least one project of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 5 (five) years; in addition, the following specific experience:
Works — Minimum requirements
Asphalt concrete pavement works: 104 000 m2 in one year
Street Lighting or Electrical Works: 14 000 l.m. in one year
Installation of basalt curbs: 6 000 l.m. in one year
— Tenderers shall have licenses for:
a) license for construction works in transport sector and

b) license for construction works in energy sector works, issued in accordance with the Armenian legislation. Absence of the required licences at the time of tender submission shall not constitute grounds for rejection, however, tenderers must demonstrate they will be able to obtain necessary licences prior to contract award.

Tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of 100 000 AMD or equivalent in a convertible currency at the exchange rate of the Central Bank of Armenia on the date of payment.
Banking details
Account name: Gyumri Municipality
IBAN/account number: 900215301616
Currency: AMD, EURO, USD
BIC/SWIFT CODE: CBRAAM22
Bank name: Central Bank of Republic of Armenia
Correspondent Bank: Commerrzbank AG, SWIFT BIC: COBADEFF

Upon receipt of appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee, the documents will promptly be dispatched by courier; however, no liability can be accepted for their loss or late delivery. In addition, if requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically after presentation by the prospective tenderer of an appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee. In the event of discrepancy between electronic and hard copies of the documents, the hard copy shall prevail.
All tenders must be accompanied by a tender security of 54 000 (fifty four thousand) EUR or its equivalent in AMD at the exchange rate of the Central Bank of Armenia on the date of security issue.

Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 17.4.2018 at 11:00 Yerevan (local time), at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
The applicable procurement rules are the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at: http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html
A register of potential tenderers who have purchased the tender documents may be inspected at the address below.
Prospective tenderers may obtain further information from, and inspect and acquire the tender documents at, the following office:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: , Head of Project Implementation Unit (Chief Adviser to the Mayor of City of Gyumri), Tel:

TI_DOC.P: EBWE - „Straßensanierungsarbeiten auf der Garegin Njdeh Avenue, Tigran Mets Avenue, Sayat Nova Street, Hayuhu Square“ CW-ICB-2018/04 (AM-Gyumri)

This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice (nº 8783-GPN-46540) for this project which was published on the EBRD website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 1.8.2017.

Municipality of Gyumri, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends using part of the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Gyumri Urban Roads Project.

The Employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan: CW-ICB-2018/04 “Road rehabilitation works on Garegin Njdeh Avenue, Tigran Mets avenue, Sayat Nova street, Hayuhu square”.
Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

— The Tenderer shall have an average annual turnover as prime contractor (defined as billing for works in progress and completed) over the last 5 (five) years of not less than 2 700 000 (two million and seven hundred thousand) EUR equivalent,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means sufficient to meet the construction cash flow for the contract for a period of 4 (four) months, estimated as not less than 770 000 (seven hundred and seventy thousand) EUR equivalent, taking into account the applicant's commitments for other contracts,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least one project of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 5 (five) years; in addition, the following specific experience:
Works — Minimum requirements
Asphalt concrete pavement works: 104 000 m2 in one year
Street Lighting or Electrical Works: 14 000 l.m. in one year
Installation of basalt curbs: 6 000 l.m. in one year
— Tenderers shall have licenses for:
a) license for construction works in transport sector and

b) license for construction works in energy sector works, issued in accordance with the Armenian legislation. Absence of the required licences at the time of tender submission shall not constitute grounds for rejection, however, tenderers must demonstrate they will be able to obtain necessary licences prior to contract award.

Tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of 100 000 AMD or equivalent in a convertible currency at the exchange rate of the Central Bank of Armenia on the date of payment.
Banking details
Account name: Gyumri Municipality
IBAN/account number: 900215301616
Currency: AMD, EURO, USD
BIC/SWIFT CODE: CBRAAM22
Bank name: Central Bank of Republic of Armenia
Correspondent Bank: Commerrzbank AG, SWIFT BIC: COBADEFF

Upon receipt of appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee, the documents will promptly be dispatched by courier; however, no liability can be accepted for their loss or late delivery. In addition, if requested, the documents can be dispatched electronically after presentation by the prospective tenderer of an appropriate evidence of payment of the non-refundable fee. In the event of discrepancy between electronic and hard copies of the documents, the hard copy shall prevail.
All tenders must be accompanied by a tender security of 54 000 (fifty four thousand) EUR or its equivalent in AMD at the exchange rate of the Central Bank of Armenia on the date of security issue.

Tenders must be delivered to the office at the address below on or before 17.4.2018 at 11:00 Yerevan (local time), at which time they will be opened in the presence of those tenderers’ representatives who choose to attend.
The applicable procurement rules are the Bank’s Procurement Policies and Rules (PP&R) which can be located at: http://www.ebrd.com/news/publications/policies/procurement-policies-and-rules.html

This Invitation for Tenders follows the General Procurement Notice (nº 8783-GPN-46540) for this project which was published on the EBRD website, Procurement Notices (www.ebrd.com) on 1.8.2017.

Municipality of Gyumri, hereinafter referred to as “the Employer”, intends using part of the proceeds of a loan from the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (the Bank) towards the cost of Gyumri Urban Roads Project.

The Employer now invites sealed tenders from contractors for the following contract to be funded from part of the proceeds of the loan: CW-ICB-2018/04 “Road rehabilitation works on Garegin Njdeh Avenue, Tigran Mets avenue, Sayat Nova street, Hayuhu square”.
Tendering for contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank is open to firms from any country.
To be qualified for the award of a contract, tenderers must satisfy the following minimum criteria:

— The Tenderer shall have an average annual turnover as prime contractor (defined as billing for works in progress and completed) over the last 5 (five) years of not less than 2 700 000 (two million and seven hundred thousand) EUR equivalent,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has access to, or has available, liquid assets, unencumbered real assets, lines of credit, and other financial means sufficient to meet the construction cash flow for the contract for a period of 4 (four) months, estimated as not less than 770 000 (seven hundred and seventy thousand) EUR equivalent, taking into account the applicant's commitments for other contracts,

— The Tenderer shall demonstrate that it has successful experience as prime contractor in the execution of at least one project of a nature and complexity comparable to the proposed contract within the last 5 (five) years; in addition, the following specific experience:
Works — Minimum requirements
Asphalt concrete pavement works: 104 000 m2 in one year
Street Lighting or Electrical Works: 14 000 l.m. in one year
Installation of basalt curbs: 6 000 l.m. in one year
— Tenderers shall have licenses for:
a) license for construction works in transport sector and

b) license for construction works in energy sector works, issued in accordance with the Armenian legislation. Absence of the required licences at the time of tender submission shall not constitute grounds for rejection, however, tenderers must demonstrate they will be able to obtain necessary licences prior to contract award.

Tender documents may be obtained from the office at the address below upon payment of a non-refundable fee of 100 000 AMD or equivalent in a convertible currency at the exchange rate of the Central Bank of Armenia on the date of payment.
